intro: Caroxylon schreiberae, commonly known as the Schreiber's caroxylon, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
